title: ğŸ‰ Liaison Program Website - Complete & Ready!
text:
You now have a professional, production-ready student resource website with everything students need to succeed in your Liaison Program course.







Home page with course overview
Getting started guide for students
Resources hub with downloads
Five course modules (Orientation through Delivery)
Built-in search functionality
Mobile-responsive design
Ready to deploy in 15 minutes





Pre-configured folder structure
6 main directories + 4 project subdirectories
Welcome/orientation file (00_START_HERE.md)
Weekly Journal Template (Connector/Troubleshooter/Critic)
Data Dictionary Template (for codebook creation)
All folders include .gitkeep files for Git tracking





README.md - Project overview and next steps
QUICK_START.md - Visual reference guide
DEPLOYMENT.md - Detailed deployment instructions
setup.qmd - Student setup guide (live on website)
resources/index.qmd - Resources page (live on website)





Phase 1: Orientation module with activities
Clear instructions for each phase
Reflection prompts using three thinking paths
Template links and resource organization

quarto render



quarto preview

git push

Add your info to index.qmd
Create syllabus.qmd
Add Phase 1 activities

Test everything

Download Liaison_Vault.zip from resources
Follow setup guide yourself
Test as a student (incognito browser)

Deploy

Choose GitHub, Netlify, or university server
Follow DEPLOYMENT.md instructions
Verify live URL works

Share

Post link to Blackboard
Test link from student perspective
Monitor for student questions

- âœ… Assignments due dates - âœ… Reflection prompts - âœ… Links to vault templates - âœ… Resources & external links
Phase 1 template has an example structure you can follow.











Problem
Solution




Website wonâ€™t build
Check _quarto.yml syntax, run quarto render again


Vault wonâ€™t download
Check resources/Liaison_Vault.zip exists


Links are broken
Verify relative paths in .qmd files


Styling looks weird
Clear browser cache, try different browser


Deployment failed
Review DEPLOYMENT.md for your chosen option

Obsidian Help: https://help.obsidian.md
GitHub Pages: https://pages.github.com

Pick your deployment option
Deploy to the web
Share link with students
Watch them succeed!

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Your complete knowledge management system for the Liaison Program. This vault includes:

00_Inbox: Quick capture area for notes and ideas
01_Journal: Weekly reflection templates (Connector/Troubleshooter/Critic)
02_Literature: Centralized space for reading notes and citations
03_Project: Active research work with codebooks and data organization
04_Resources: Attachment storage for images, PDFs, and media
99_Templates: Ready-to-use templates for assignments and documentation

ğŸ“¥ Download Liaison_Vault.zip - Extract this to get started immediately.

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Your complete knowledge management system for the Liaison Program. This vault includes:

00_Inbox: Quick capture area for notes and ideas
01_Journal: Weekly reflection templates (Connector/Troubleshooter/Critic)
02_Literature: Centralized space for reading notes and citations
03_Project: Active research work with codebooks and data organization
04_Resources: Attachment storage for images, PDFs, and media
99_Templates: Ready-to-use templates for assignments and documentation

ğŸ“¥ Download Liaison_Vault.zip - Extract this to get started immediately.

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Software & Tools
Before starting Phase 1, ensure you have these installed:

Required

Obsidian - FREE - Your note-taking workspace
Git - FREE - Version control for your projects
VS Code - FREE - Code editor



Recommended

Python 3.10+ - FREE - For data analysis and automation
R & RStudio - FREE - Statistical analysis

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Documentation & Guides

Quick Start

Setting up your Obsidian Vault - 5 minutes
Understanding the Liaison Program Structure - 10 minutes



Templates Available in Your Vault

Weekly Journal Template - For reflective practice with three thinking paths
Data Dictionary Template - For codebook creation and variable definition

title: Resources & Downloads
text:
Getting Help

Questions about the program? Check your moduleâ€™s orientation page
Technical issues? Review the Software & Tools section above
Need to provide feedback? Use the Inbox in your Obsidian Vault


Last updated: January 2026

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text: In this phase, youâ€™ll: - Understand your role as a Communication Liaison - Set up your digital workspace - Learn the program structure - Get familiar with Obsidian and your vault

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text: In this phase, youâ€™ll: - Understand your role as a Communication Liaison - Set up your digital workspace - Learn the program structure - Get familiar with Obsidian and your vault

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
What is a Communication Liaison?
Edit this section with your course context and examples.
A Communication Liaison bridges the gap between: - Data scientists who understand the numbers - Creative teams who understand the audience - Project stakeholders who understand the goals
Your job is to translate, facilitate, and document.

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
The Five-Phase Journey
Phase 1 â†’ Phase 2 â†’ Phase 3 â†’ Phase 4 â†’ Phase 5
Orientation Discovery Dictionary Execution Delivery
Each phase builds skills youâ€™ll use throughout your career.

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Activities for Phase 1

Activity 1: Complete Your Setup (Homework)

Go to the Resources page and download Liaison_Vault.zip
Follow the Setup Guide step-by-step
Configure your Obsidian vault
Open your 00_START_HERE.md file

Due: Before our next meeting


Activity 2: Explore Your Vault (In Class)

Open your Liaison_Vault in Obsidian
Create a file in 00_Inbox named First_Reflection.md
Write 3-5 sentences about what you hope to learn this semester



Activity 3: Vault Navigation Tour (Self-Paced)
Navigate through each folder and understand: - What goes in each folder - How folders connect to each other - Why the structure matters for your thinking

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Key Concepts

The Liaison Mindset

Translate: Turn jargon into clarity
Facilitate: Help people understand each other
Document: Create records for future reference
Guide: Lead projects toward success



Tools Youâ€™ll Use

Obsidian - Your personal knowledge system
GitHub - Version control and collaboration
Quarto - Documentation and reporting
Data tools - R, Python, Excel (in later phases)

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Reflection Prompt
Before moving to Phase 2, write a journal entry in 01_Journal/ answering:
â€œWhat does it mean to be a Communication Liaison in my field? Who do I need to bridge gaps between?â€
Use one of the three thinking paths: 1. The Connector - How does this relate to what I already know? 2. The Troubleshooter - What challenges might I face? 3. The Critic - Does this resonate with my experience?

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Resources for This Phase

ğŸ“– [Your course readings - add links here]
ğŸ¥ [Your video tutorials - add links here]
ğŸ“ [Your lecture slides - add links here]
ğŸ”— [External resources - add links here]

title: Phase 1: Orientation
text:
Next Steps
Once you complete Phase 1: 1. âœ… Vault is set up and configured 2. âœ… Youâ€™ve explored all folders 3. âœ… Youâ€™ve written your first journal reflection 4. â†’ Move to Phase 2: Discovery

Questions? Use your Inbox in Obsidian or reach out during office hours.

title: Data Dictionary
text:
Data Dictionary









Variable Name
Conceptual Definition (The Dictionary)
Operational Definition (The Checklist)
Levels of Measurement




frame_type
The dominant angle of the story.
1 = Economic, 2 = Conflict, 3 = Human Interest
Nominal


tone
The emotional feeling of the text.
Count of negative words vs positive words.
Ratio

title: ğŸ“‹ Website Launch Checklist
text:
File: index.qmd

Add your instructor name
Add meeting time and location
Add your office hours
Add contact email/phone
Customize the course description
Review the quick-start buttons




File: syllabus.qmd (create this file)
Add: - [ ] Course title and number - [ ] Course description - [ ] Learning objectives - [ ] Required materials - [ ] Grading breakdown - [ ] Attendance policy - [ ] Academic integrity statement - [ ] Disability services info - [ ] Office hours and contact info



Files: modules/01_orientation/index.qmd through modules/05_delivery/index.qmd
For each phase: - [ ] Update learning objectives - [ ] Add readings/videos - [ ] Add activities with due dates - [ ] Add reflection prompts - [ ] Link to templates - [ ] Add resources
(Phase 1 has an example you can follow!)







Steps in DEPLOYMENT.md: 1. Create GitHub account & repository 2. Push your code 3. Enable GitHub Pages in settings 4. Share URL: https://yourname.github.io/quarto_website
Time: ~15 minutes
Cost: FREE
Updates: Automatic when you push



Steps in DEPLOYMENT.md: 1. Sign up at netlify.com 2. Connect GitHub repo 3. Configure build settings 4. Deploy!
Time: ~10 minutes
Cost: FREE
Updates: Automatic when you push



Steps in DEPLOYMENT.md: 1. Contact your IT department 2. Get FTP/server access 3. Upload _site/ folder 4. Get your URL
Time: ~30 minutes
Cost: Usually FREE
Updates: Manual FTP upload





Test the student experience:

Download Vault

Go to Resources page
Download Liaison_Vault.zip
Verify it downloads and extracts

Follow Setup Guide

Go to â€œGetting Startedâ€ page
Follow ALL steps yourself
Verify each step works
Note any issues

Use Obsidian

Open vault in Obsidian
Check all 6 folders exist
Verify templates are there
Create a test note
Verify 00_START_HERE.md is readable

Test as a Student

Open site in private/incognito browser
Try clicking all links
Try downloading the vault
Try following the setup guide
Pretend youâ€™re a new student









Finalize all customizations
Test everything thoroughly
Fix any broken links
Get feedback from a colleague





Run quarto render one final time
Deploy (GitHub, Netlify, or server)
Test the live URL
Verify Vault downloads correctly





Post URL to Blackboard
Send announcement to students
Monitor for questions/issues
Update content as needed






Every time you update:
# 1. Make your changes to .qmd files in VS Code
# 2. Build the site
quarto render

# 3. If using GitHub:
git add .
git commit -m "Update course materials"
git push

# 4. If using Netlify:
# (Automatic! Just push to GitHub)

# 5. If using university server:
# Upload _site/ folder via FTP




Website wonâ€™t build: - Check _quarto.yml for syntax errors - Run quarto render again - See DEPLOYMENT.md
Links are broken: - Check file paths in .qmd files - Use relative paths: setup.qmd, resources/Liaison_Vault.zip - Never use absolute paths
Vault wonâ€™t download: - Verify resources/Liaison_Vault.zip exists - Check file permissions - Try manually downloading from resources page
Looks weird on mobile: - Quarto is responsive by default - Clear browser cache - Try different browser - Check for custom CSS conflicts




Set your own dates:

Week 1: Customization complete, deployed
Week 2: Module 1 content added
Week 3: Module 2 content added
Week 4: Module 3 content added
Week 5: Module 4 content added
Week 6: Module 5 content added





After launch, youâ€™ll know itâ€™s working when:
âœ… Students access the website
âœ… Students download the Vault
âœ… Students complete setup
âœ… Students ask informed questions
âœ… Students use templates
âœ… Students progress through phases




This is YOUR site. Feel free to: - Change colors/themes - Add more content - Create custom templates - Link to external resources - Update weekly - Gather student feedback - Iterate and improve
Your students have access to a professional learning environment. Great job! ğŸ‰

Quick Links to Guides: - START_HERE.md - Complete overview - README.md - Full project guide
- DEPLOYMENT.md - Deployment instructions - QUICK_START.md - Visual reference

Time: ~10 minutes
Cost: FREE
Updates: Automatic when you push



Steps in DEPLOYMENT.md: 1. Contact your IT department 2. Get FTP/server access 3. Upload _site/ folder 4. Get your URL
Time: ~30 minutes
Cost: Usually FREE
Updates: Manual FTP upload

title: ğŸ“‹ Website Launch Checklist
text:
Test the student experience:

Download Vault

Go to Resources page
Download Liaison_Vault.zip
Verify it downloads and extracts

Follow Setup Guide

Go to â€œGetting Startedâ€ page
Follow ALL steps yourself
Verify each step works
Note any issues

Use Obsidian

Open vault in Obsidian
Check all 6 folders exist
Verify templates are there
Create a test note
Verify 00_START_HERE.md is readable

Test as a Student

Open site in private/incognito browser
Try clicking all links
Try downloading the vault
Try following the setup guide
Pretend youâ€™re a new student

Test everything thoroughly
Fix any broken links
Get feedback from a colleague

Verify Vault downloads correctly





Post URL to Blackboard
Send announcement to students
Monitor for questions/issues
Update content as needed

title: ğŸ“‹ Website Launch Checklist
text:
Website wonâ€™t build: - Check _quarto.yml for syntax errors - Run quarto render again - See DEPLOYMENT.md
Links are broken: - Check file paths in .qmd files - Use relative paths: setup.qmd, resources/Liaison_Vault.zip - Never use absolute paths
Vault wonâ€™t download: - Verify resources/Liaison_Vault.zip exists - Check file permissions - Try manually downloading from resources page
Looks weird on mobile: - Quarto is responsive by default - Clear browser cache - Try different browser - Check for custom CSS conflicts

title: ğŸ“‹ Website Launch Checklist

Week 3: Module 2 content added

Week 5: Module 4 content added
Week 6: Module 5 content added

title: GitHub Deployment Instructions
text:
Go to https://github.com/SIM-Lab-SIUE
Click the â€œNewâ€ button (or go to https://github.com/organizations/SIM-Lab-SIUE/repositories/new)
Fill in the repository details:

Repository name: mc451-liaison-program (or your preferred name)
Description: Liaison Program course website with Obsidian vault for students
Visibility: Choose Public (so GitHub Pages works for free)
DO NOT initialize with README, .gitignore, or license (we already have these)

Click â€œCreate repositoryâ€




Once you create the repository, GitHub will show you commands. Use these:
git remote add origin https://github.com/SIM-Lab-SIUE/mc451-liaison-program.git
git push -u origin main
OR run this command in your terminal:
cd C:\mc451-sp26\quarto_website
git remote add origin https://github.com/SIM-Lab-SIUE/mc451-liaison-program.git
git push -u origin main



After pushing:

Go to your repository on GitHub
Click Settings â†’ Pages (in the left sidebar)
Under â€œBuild and deploymentâ€:

Source: Deploy from a branch
Branch: main
Folder: /_site

Click Save

GitHub will build your site. Wait 2-3 minutes, then your site will be live at:
https://sim-lab-siue.github.io/mc451-liaison-program/



Copy your GitHub Pages URL and post it in Blackboard:
ğŸ“š Course Website
Access all Liaison Program materials here:
https://sim-lab-siue.github.io/mc451-liaison-program/

You'll find:
âœ“ Getting started guide
âœ“ Liaison Obsidian Vault download
âœ“ All course modules and materials
âœ“ Weekly templates and resources

Start with the "Get Started" page!



Whenever you make changes:
cd C:\mc451-sp26\quarto_website
quarto render
git add .
git commit -m "Update course materials"
git push
GitHub Pages will automatically rebuild in 2-3 minutes.




If mc451-liaison-program is taken, try: - liaison-program-website - mc451-sp26 - communication-liaison-course - liaison-research-methods




Q: GitHub Pages shows 404 - Make sure you selected /_site folder (not root) - Wait 3-5 minutes for the first build - Check Settings â†’ Pages for build status
Q: Push failed - authentication error - You may need to set up a Personal Access Token - Go to GitHub Settings â†’ Developer settings â†’ Personal access tokens - Create token with repo scope - Use token as password when pushing
Q: Resource files (Liaison_Vault.zip) not showing - The .gitignore should NOT exclude resources/ - Check that resources/Liaison_Vault.zip was committed - Run: git ls-files resources/ to verify

Ready to go! Create the repository on GitHub, then run the push commands above. ğŸš€

title: Deployment Guide
text: Congratulations! Your student resource website has been successfully built. Hereâ€™s how to deploy it for your students.

title: Deployment Guide
text: Congratulations! Your student resource website has been successfully built. Hereâ€™s how to deploy it for your students.

title: Deployment Guide
text:
What You Have
âœ… Quarto Website - A fully functional, professional resource site
âœ… Liaison Vault - Pre-configured Obsidian vault for students
âœ… Setup Instructions - Step-by-step guide for students
âœ… Built HTML - Ready to deploy (in the _site/ folder)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Deployment Options

Option 1: GitHub Pages (Recommended - FREE)

Create a GitHub repository

Go to github.com and create a new public repo named quarto_website

Push your site
cd C:\mc451-sp26\quarto_website
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit: Liaison Program website"
git branch -M main
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/quarto_website.git
git push -u origin main
Enable GitHub Pages

Go to your repo Settings â†’ Pages
Set Source to â€œDeploy from a branchâ€
Set Branch to main and folder to _site
Your site will be live at: https://YOUR_USERNAME.github.io/quarto_website

Share the link in Blackboard

Copy the GitHub Pages URL
Add it to your Blackboard course as a web link or announcement




Option 2: Netlify (FREE, Easier Setup)

Go to netlify.com and sign up
Click â€œNew site from Gitâ€ and connect your GitHub repo
Set Build Command to: quarto render
Set Publish Directory to: _site
Deploy automatically on every push



Option 3: University Server/Portal
Contact your IT department about hosting the _site/ folder on your institutionâ€™s server.

title: Deployment Guide
text:
What Students See
When students visit your site, theyâ€™ll find:

Home page - Welcome and quick-start buttons
Setup instructions - How to install and configure Obsidian
Resources page - Downloads (Liaison_Vault.zip and tools)
Five phase modules - Course content (01_orientation through 05_delivery)
Sidebar navigation - Easy access to all sections

title: Deployment Guide
text:
After Deployment

Share with Students
Add this to your Blackboard Course:
ğŸ“š Course Resources
Welcome! Access all course materials here: [YOUR_WEBSITE_URL]

On this site you'll find:
âœ“ Your Liaison Obsidian Vault (download & setup)
âœ“ Step-by-step getting started guide
âœ“ All course modules and materials
âœ“ Weekly templates and tools

Start with the Setup page if this is your first time!


Keep It Updated
After deployment, whenever you update content:

Edit your .qmd files in VS Code
Run quarto render to rebuild
Git commit and push to update the live site
git add .
git commit -m "Update course materials"
git push

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Customization Tips

Update Your Course Info
Edit index.qmd to add: - Instructor name and contact info - Meeting times and location - Office hours


Add More Content
Create new .qmd files in the modules/ folder and add them to _quarto.yml sidebar


Change the Theme
In _quarto.yml, change the theme from cosmo to: - darkly - Dark theme - readable - High contrast - lumen - Light and clean - spacelab - Modern


Add Syllabus
Create syllabus.qmd (itâ€™s already referenced in the sidebar!)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
File Structure
quarto_website/
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml          # Site config & navigation
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd            # Home page
â”œâ”€â”€ setup.qmd            # Getting started guide
â”œâ”€â”€ syllabus.qmd         # Add your course syllabus here
â”œâ”€â”€ build_vault.py       # Script that created your vault
â”œâ”€â”€ resources/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd        # Resources page
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Liaison_Vault.zip # Student download
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/             # Course content (5 phases)
â”œâ”€â”€ slides/              # Presentation slides (optional)
â”œâ”€â”€ assignments/         # Assignment details (optional)
â””â”€â”€ _site/               # Built website (don't edit directly)

title: Deployment Guide
text:
Next Steps

Add your syllabus - Create/edit syllabus.qmd
Customize home page - Edit index.qmd with your details
Add module content - Fill in each phase (01-05) modules
Deploy - Choose Option 1, 2, or 3 above
Share link - Post in Blackboard for your students


Questions or need help? Let me know - I can help you customize this further!

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Welcome! As a Communication Liaison, you are the vital bridge between our data scientists and creative teams. Your role is to:

Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights
Facilitate collaboration between technical and creative professionals
Document findings and processes for team understanding
Guide projects from discovery through delivery

This program is designed to equip you with the research methodologies, tools, and frameworks you need to excel in this unique position. Over five phases, youâ€™ll develop the skills to navigate data-driven projects while maintaining clear communication across all stakeholders.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Welcome! As a Communication Liaison, you are the vital bridge between our data scientists and creative teams. Your role is to:

Translate complex data concepts into clear, actionable insights
Facilitate collaboration between technical and creative professionals
Document findings and processes for team understanding
Guide projects from discovery through delivery

This program is designed to equip you with the research methodologies, tools, and frameworks you need to excel in this unique position. Over five phases, youâ€™ll develop the skills to navigate data-driven projects while maintaining clear communication across all stakeholders.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Quick Start
Ready to begin your journey? Start with our setup guide to configure your workspace and understand the program structure.
â†’ Get Started

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Essential Resources
Download the Liaison Obsidian Vault â€” your complete knowledge management system with templates, structure, and documentation to succeed in this program.
â†’ Download Liaison_Vault.zip
Or visit the Resources page to see whatâ€™s included and other helpful downloads.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
The Five Phases
This program is structured in five interconnected phases:

Phase 1: Orientation - Understand your role, the program structure, and set up your workspace
Phase 2: Discovery - Learn research methodologies and how to ask the right questions
Phase 3: The Dictionary - Master codebook creation and variable definition
Phase 4: Execution - Apply what youâ€™ve learned to real projects
Phase 5: Delivery - Present findings and communicate impact

Each phase builds on the previous one. Start with Phase 1 in the sidebar.

title: Welcome to the Data Team
text:
Course Information

Instructor: [Your Name]
Meeting Time: [Your Schedule]
Office Hours: [Your Availability]
Questions? See the syllabus for contact information


Letâ€™s get to work and build something great together!

title: Welcome to your Digital Office
text:
00_Inbox: Quick notes and rough thoughts.
01_Journal: Your weekly field notes.
02_Literature: Notes from Zotero and readings.
03_Project: Your active research work.
99_Templates: Copy these files to start your assignments.



Go to Settings > Files & Links > Default location for new attachments â†’ set to â€˜04_Resourcesâ€™.

title: Welcome to your Digital Office
text: Go to Settings > Files & Links > Default location for new attachments â†’ set to â€˜04_Resourcesâ€™.

title: Weekly Journal Entry Guide
text:
Each week, youâ€™ll reflect on course material using one of three approaches. Pick the one that connects most to what youâ€™re thinking about this week.






Definition: Link this weekâ€™s material to something biggerâ€”your project, a previous concept, real-world examples, or your own experience.
Example Prompt: â€œHow does this weekâ€™s reading connect to what Iâ€™m working on?â€




Definition: Document a challenge you faced and how you worked through itâ€”technical, conceptual, or practical.
Example Prompt: â€œWhat was difficult this week, and how did I solve it?â€




Definition: Ask a critical question about the material. Challenge an assumption, identify a gap, or explore an implication.
Example Prompt: â€œWhat question or assumption from this week intrigues or concerns me?â€






Length: 250-300 words
Due: Every Friday by 11:59 PM
Choose ONE approach and delete the other two
Tag: Include #journal #weekX at the bottom

text: Each week, youâ€™ll reflect on course material using one of three approaches. Pick the one that connects most to what youâ€™re thinking about this week.

Definition: Ask a critical question about the material. Challenge an assumption, identify a gap, or explore an implication.

After deployment, making changes is easy:

Build by running quarto render

# Standard update workflow
quarto render
git add .
git commit -m "Update course materials"
git push







Make the Getting Started page prominent
Include screenshots in setup.qmd
Link to Obsidian help resources
Create a â€œCommon Issuesâ€ section

Include readings, videos, and activities
Add reflection prompts

Create a FAQ section

# Phase X: [Title]

## Learning Objectives
- Objective 1
- Objective 2
- Objective 3

- Concept A: explanation
- Concept B: explanation

## Activities
1. Activity name
   - Step 1
   - Step 2
   - Due date

- Video 1
- Template link

## Reflection Prompt
[Use the three thinking paths]

format:
  html:
    theme: cosmo  # Try: darkly, lumen, readable, spacelab




Create new file.qmd
Add to _quarto.yml sidebar
Run quarto render
Redeploy!

When students visit your site:

Land on home page â†’ See course overview
Click â€œGet Startedâ€ â†’ View step-by-step setup
Go to Resources â†’ Download Liaison_Vault.zip
Follow setup guide â†’ Install Obsidian & vault
Enter Phase 1 â†’ Begin course content
Use templates â†’ Weekly journals, data dictionaries
Learn through 5 phases â†’ Complete program
Succeed! â†’ Ready for future careers

GitHub Pages: https://pages.github.com/
Your students: Use Blackboard announcements

title: Getting Started
text: This page will guide you through your initial setup. Complete these steps before Phase 1.

title: Getting Started
text: This page will guide you through your initial setup. Complete these steps before Phase 1.

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 1: Download Your Workspace (5 minutes)
Visit the Resources page and download the Liaison_Vault.zip file.
Extract it to a location like: - Mac/Linux: ~/Documents/Liaison_Vault - Windows: C:\Users\YourName\Documents\Liaison_Vault

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 2: Install Obsidian (5 minutes)

Go to obsidian.md and download Obsidian
Install it on your computer
Open Obsidian and select â€œOpen folder as vaultâ€
Navigate to your Liaison_Vault folder and open it

First time in Obsidian? - Click the folder icon on the left sidebar to see your vault structure - Open 00_START_HERE.md to read your orientation guide

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 3: Configure Obsidian Settings (3 minutes)
Once your vault is open in Obsidian:

Go to Settings (gear icon, bottom left)
Click Files & Links in the sidebar
Under â€œDefault location for new attachmentsâ€, select 04_Resources
This ensures all images, PDFs, and media files go to the right place

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 4: Explore Your Vault Structure
Your vault contains:








Folder
Purpose
Action




00_Inbox
Quick notes & ideas
Capture thoughts here first


01_Journal
Weekly reflections
Use the template to reflect each week


02_Literature
Reading notes
Store all your research notes here


03_Project
Active research work
Organize by prospectus, codebook, data, drafts


04_Resources
Media & attachments
Images, PDFs, external files


99_Templates
Reusable templates
Copy these to start assignments

title: Getting Started
section: Step 5: Review the Weekly Journal Template (5 minutes)
text:
Step 5: Review the Weekly Journal Template (5 minutes)
Open 99_Templates â†’ Weekly_Journal_Template.md
This template guides you to reflect using one of three thinking paths: - The Connector: How does this apply to my project? - The Troubleshooter: What broke and how did I fix it? - The Critic: Does this hold true in my experience?

title: Getting Started
text:
Step 6: Youâ€™re Ready!
Once you complete these steps, move to Phase 1: Orientation in the sidebar to begin.

title: Getting Started
text:
Troubleshooting
Q: I extracted the ZIP file but Obsidian wonâ€™t open it as a vault - Make sure youâ€™re opening the folder that contains the .obsidian hidden folder - Try right-clicking the folder and checking â€œShow hidden filesâ€ if needed
Q: Where do I put my weekly journal entries? - Create a new file in 01_Journal named something like Week_01_MyName.md - Copy the template from 99_Templates/Weekly_Journal_Template.md and fill it out
Q: Can I share my vault with classmates? - Yes! You can email them the ZIP file, or sync it via Git/GitHub for collaborative projects

Questions? Reach out via your course management system or check your course syllabus for contact information.
